snippet: Almost a year after Chen Guangcheng was released to the United States, he said that his family remains under surveillance in China, and his jailed nephew has been  beaten.
abstract: Chinese human rights advocate Chen Guangcheng says that his family remains under surveillance almost a year after his daring escape to America from detention in his home village; Chen adds that his jailed nephew has been beaten and warned by officials not to challenge his conviction.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Almost a year after Chen Guangcheng was released to the United States, he said that his family remains under surveillance in China, and his jailed nephew has been  beaten.

headline.seo: Chen Guangcheng, Now in U.S., Says Family in China Is Harassed
headline.main: Chinese Activist, Now in U.S., Says His Relatives Remain Under Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Chinese Activist, Now in U.S., Says His Relatives Remain Under Surveillance

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
